description.narrative:
Global Rights will be the lead implementer of the initiative for developing a Community Monitoring Network for the East Africa Crude Oil Pipeline (EACOP). The initiative involves identifying, mobilizing and training a network of community-based actors and equipping them with tools to monitor human rights issues associated with the development of the EACOP. Goal of the initiative Promoting community#s rights through adherence to Free, Prior and Informed Consent (FPIC) in the EACOP land acquisition anddevelopment processes Objectives 1. To mobilize,raise awareness and offer platforms for women and men likely to be affected by the proposed East Africa Crude Oil Pipeline and strengthen their participation in decision making. 2. To train and equip a network of community-based monitors for monitoring human rights issues in the development and operation of the EACOP. 3. To facilitate redress of rights violations through sub-national, national and regional level advocacy efforts and provide feedback to affected communities
What sort of sub-activities are envisaged? # Development of simplified FPIC and human rights monitoring tool. # Mobilization and Training of at least 45 community monitors in human rights and pipeline/extractives monitoring in each of the eight districts # Establishing and managing a toll-free hotline call center for reporting and documenting emerging issues. # Establishing and managing platforms (web-base and others) for information on key governance issues associated with thedevelopment of the EACOP.

participating-org.narrative: The organization was formed in 2007 by Ugandans to address human rights and development. The mission of GRA is to promote social accountability through constructive engagement of rights holders and duty bearers. Global Rights Alert has been guided by a strategic Plan 20122017, together with key governance instruments. However in order to address the emerging demands and keep relevance, a number of reviews have been undertaken and some of these governance documents amended. Currently, there is an amended constitution, the strategic plan 201722 Is under formulation. All the other governance documents are also being reviewed to be in tandem with constitution. The organization has a gender policy and her staff have been trained in gender mainstreaming. Oneof GRA#s core programmes is Gender and Extractives, which is testimony to our belief that women, just like men have a right to development and must be supported to realize their potential. GRA is an equal opportunity employer, and ensures that all her staff gender specific needs that relate to our work are met. 2. ACHIEVEMENTS What have been the principal results in the past three years that contribute to significant, structural, sustained and positive improvement in the lives of men, women, girls and boys suffering from poverty, injustice, insecurityand exclusion? GRA has implemented several projects including #Promoting Gender Participation in the Social Accountability and Development Process of Uganda's Oil and Gas Sector#, #Extracting Equality inUganda's Natural Resource Sector#, Enhancing citizenry participation in the Natural Resources Sector# #Enhancing accountability and operating space and safety of HR/ Environment for Actors#, among others. GRA has provided women, men and youth, to access information on Uganda;s Exractive Industries (EI) development process.Our intervention has enabled rural communities host communities to have a voice, participate in formulation of sector laws and policies as well as guide operations on the ground. With the increased acquisition of land for oil infrastructure development, women, girls and youth are at the core of advocacy for respect of land rights, livelihoods and social service delivery. The respect for marginalised and vulnerable group especially eldery and womn has been amplified by GRA#s trainings, dilalgues and advocacy initiatives ( 2 Error! Unknown document property name. 8 )
